Glváčovo odstúpenie môže Smeru pomôcť, pred dušičkami by bol jeho odchod výhrou opozície
07 Nov 2019, 17:35 by Webnoviny
7.11.2019 (Webnoviny.sk) – Ak by Martin Glváč (Smer-SD) odišiel z funkcie podpredsedu Národnej rady SR ešte pred dušičkami, bolo by to vnímané ako výhra opozície.
Pre agentúru SITA to uviedol politológ z Fakulty aplikovaných jazykov Ekonomickej univerzity v Bratislave Radoslav Štefančík v reakcii na ohlásenú Glváčovu rezignáciu. Politológ zdôraznil, že v čase predvolebnej kampane, keď už neplatí koaličná zmluva, Glváčovi neostávalo nič iné ako odchod. Stranu Smer-SD to podľa neho nepoškodí.
„Pre Smer-SD by bolo menej výhodné, keby bol Glváč odvolaný zo svojej pozície. Keďže už nebolo isté, či ho koalícia podrží, zvolil takýto krok. Stranu to nepoškodí, práve naopak, môže im to len prospieť. Počas volebnej kampane môžu argumentovať, že sa u nich prejavil vyšší štandard politickej kultúry,“ konštatoval Štefančík.
Opozícia tlačila na Glváčov odchod pre informácie o jeho intenzívnej komunikácii s Marianom K., ktorý čelí obžalobe v prípade vraždy investigatívneho novinára Jána Kuciaka. Glváč tvrdí, že je obeťou kampane voči jeho osobe a strane Smer-SD a hrozí odvetnými krokmi predsedovi koaličného Mosta-Híd Bélovi Bugárovi či šéfovi opozičnej strany Sme rodina Borisovi Kollárovi.

Glvac's resignation can help Direction, before his souls his departure would win the opposition
07 Nov 2019, 17:35 by Webnoviny
7.11.2019 (Webnoviny.sk) - If Martin Glváč (Smer-SD) left the office of vice-chairman of the National Council of the Slovak Republic before the souls, it would be perceived as a win of the opposition.
For SITA, a political scientist from the Faculty of Applied Languages of the University of Economics in Bratislava, Radoslav Štefančík, said this in response to the reported resignation of Glváč. The political scientist stressed that at the time of the election campaign, when the coalition treaty was no longer in place, Glváč had no choice but to leave. According to him, this would not hurt the Smer-SD party.
“It would be less advantageous for Smer-SD if Glvac was removed from his position. Since it was no longer certain that the coalition would hold him, he took such a step. It will not hurt the party, on the contrary, it can only benefit them. During the election campaign, they can argue that they have a higher standard of political culture, ”said Štefančík.
Opposition pushed Glvac to leave for information about his intensive communication with Marian K., who is facing charges of murder of investigative journalist Jan Kuciak. Glvac claims that he is the victim of a campaign against him and Smer-SD and threatens to retaliate with the chairman of the coalition bridge Most-Híd Béla Bugár or the head of the opposition party We Are Family Boris Kollár.
